clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Universal Prevention Curriculum for Schools in Peru
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Universal Prevention Curriculum for Schools in Peru

brief_summary.textblock: This randomized controlled trial was conducted to evaluate a universal prevention curriculum (UPC) training for Peruvian school administrators and teachers to reduce substance use among students. Twenty-eight schools were randomly assigned to intervention and control conditions (14 per condition). Substance use outcomes were assessed with repeated cross-sectional samples of students in 2018 and 2019. Multi-level analyses were conducted to assess intervention effects on students' substance use and related problems.

detailed_description.textblock: This randomized controlled trial was conducted to evaluate a universal prevention curriculum (UPC) training for Peruvian school administrators and teachers to reduce substance use among students. Twenty-eight schools were randomly assigned to intervention and control conditions (14 per condition). Prevention leadership action teams were formed at intervention schools to implement evidence-based school policies and positive school climate activities, and a classroom substance use prevention curriculum. Substance use outcomes were assessed with repeated cross-sectional samples of students in 2018 and 2019. Multi-level analyses were conducted to assess intervention effects on students' substance use and related problems.

primary_outcome.description: Five or more consecutive alcoholic drinks
Use of inhalants, cocaine, PCB, hallucinogens
Friends' use of tobacco, alcohol, marijuana and other drugs
Awareness of school tobacco and alcohol policies

arm_group.description: Received UPC training, school policy and climate interventions, and Unplugged prevention program

intervention.intervention_name: Universal Prevention Curriculum Training for Schools
intervention.description: School administrators and teachers participated in UPC training and formed prevention leadership action teams

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Students in participating schools aged 11 to 19
Exclusion Criteria:
- Not attending participating schools
